TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE , upon the applicant ’s request , the Director of ORG ( FAC ) issued a decision and ordered division of the applicant ’s property into a number of smaller plots , designated for construction purposes . By the same decision CARDINAL of these plots were expropriated and acquired by the FAC municipality , for the purpose of road construction . The applicant did not appeal against this decision and consequently , it became final on DATE .

On DATE the Director of ORG determined the amount of compensation to be paid to the applicant for the expropriated plots at PLZ ( old zlotys ) CARDINAL . The applicant contested this decision and asked for a new expert opinion in order to re - assess the value of the plots .

In view of the new expert opinion , on DATE the Director of ORG set the amount of compensation to be paid to the applicant at PLZ MONEY . ORG ( Zarząd Miasta ) lodged an appeal against this decision with the Governor of FAC . On DATE the Governor of ORG upheld the contested decision . ORG appealed to ORG ( PERSON ) . On CARDINAL DATE ORG quashed the contested decision . The court ordered that the amount of compensation to be paid to the applicant should be reconsidered by the second - instance authority .

On DATE the FAC Governor quashed the first - instance decision of DATE and remitted the case to the first instance authority . On DATE the Director of ORG for the third time set the amount of applicant ’s compensation , this time at PLZ CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL . Both , the applicant and ORG appealed

On DATE the Governor of ORG ( PERSON ) , acting of his own motion , considered that the expropriation decision of DATE had been given in a flagrant breach of substantive provisions of administrative law . In the Governor ’s opinion acquisition of lands for road construction by municipalities should have been done by way of a civil contract between the applicant and the municipality . Expropriation would only have been possible had the applicant refused to accept conditions of the proposed contract . However , due to the fact that some of the plots as created by the DATE decision had already been sold by the applicant , the Governor refused to declare this decision null and void as it had already created irreversible legal consequences .
The applicant lodged an appeal against this decision . On DATE the Minister of ORG ( Minister PERSON i GPE ) quashed Governor ’s decision of DATE and remitted the case .
On DATE the Governor of ORG stayed the compensation proceedings until termination of the proceedings concerning the validity and lawfulness of the expropriation decision of DATE .

On DATE the Governor of ORG declared the decision of DATE null and void in so far as it concerned expropriation of the plot no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , designated for broadening of an existing street . It was further stated that the plot no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL should be acquired again by the municipality by entering into a civil contract with the applicant or , in the absence of an agreement on the price , by a new expropriation decision , as provided for by the DATE Land Administration and Expropriation Act .

The applicant appealed against this decision , submitting that as a result of this decision the plots sold to third parties would lose access to a public road , which they had had through the plot no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL .
On DATE the Director of ORG ( Prezes Urzędu Mieszkalnictwa i PERSON ) quashed the contested decision and remitted the case to the Governor of ORG for reconsideration .

On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal with ORG against the decision of DATE alleging that it was in breach of substantive administrative law . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal , considering that the decision was given in compliance with the law . As a result of this decision , the FAC municipality was to return the plot no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL to the applicant .
On DATE the Governor of ORG discontinued the proceedings in which the validity of the DATE division and expropriation decision was examined . The case was subsequently transmitted to ORG ( PERSON ) .

On DATE the ORG of Appeal declared the decision of DATE null and void in so far as it concerned expropriation of the plot no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , finding that it had been issued in a breach of the DATE Act on land administration and expropriation . ORG refused to declare this decision null and void in its entirety , despite its legal flaws , because of the irreversible legal consequences that had ensued .
As a result of this decision the plot no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL was returned to the applicant .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against the decision of DATE . The court held that applicant had failed to comply with the formal requirements attached to this remedy , as she had not lodged a request to have the decision reconsidered by ORG . This decision is final .
